title: Asylum seeker dies by suicide at Lakemba's Darul Ulam mosque in Sydney's south-west
text:
An asylum seeker has taken his own life at a suburban Sydney mosque, with worshippers making the grim discovery as they gathered for evening prayers.

Mohammad Mohsin Biswas, 33, was tragically found dead at the Darul Ulam Islamic centre in the city's south-west about 5.30pm on Sunday.

Daily Mail Australia has been told Mr Biswas first arrived from Bangladesh by boat in 2013, but his hope for a new life didn't become a reality.

Mohammad Mohsin Biswas, 33, was found dead at the Darul Ulam mosque on Sunday, as worshippers gathered for their evening prayers

He applied to the government for a protection visa, saying he feared persecution back home in Bangladesh, but that was rejected.

Mr Biswas was appealing the decision at the Federal Circuit Court but a refugee advocate claimed he had recently had become 'homeless and destitute'.

Campaigner Ian Rintoul said he understood Mr Biswas was on a bridging visa, which meant he had 'no income and did not have the right to work'.

'He was destitute and had become homeless relying on charity and support from others in the Bangladeshi community,' he said.

'After being supported for many months by friends, he had spent the last few months going from couch to couch.'

The mosque had given him shelter in a room upstairs and that was where his body was found.

Mr Biswas was homeless and the Lakemba mosque (above) gave him a room to live in upstairs. That was where a worshipper made a grim discovery on Sunday evening

Mosque spokesman Syed Hasan said the incident was a 'very sad thing' and 'it's just a shock', and confirmed it had offered Mr Biswas shelter.

Mr Hasan said about 30 worshippers had attended the centre for prayers that evening.

A New South Wales police spokesman confirmed Mr Biswas' death was 'non-suspicious' and that a report is being prepared for the Coroner.

Daily Mail Australia contacted the Department of Home Affairs for comment on Tuesday, seeking to clarify Mr Biswas's legal status at the time of his death.

For confidential crisis support, call Lifeline on 13 11 14.
description: An asylum seeker has taken his own life at a mosque in Sydney's south-west, with worshippers making the grim discovery as they gathered for evening prayers.
authors: Daniel Piotrowski For Daily Mail Australia
